163  DebugPrinter() : outstream(&std::cout), _prec(5), hcol("36") {}
164 
165  template <typename T>
166  friend DebugPrinter & operator<<(DebugPrinter & d, const T& output);
167  friend inline DebugPrinter & operator<<(DebugPrinter & d,
168  std::ostream& (*pf)(std::ostream&));

173 
174  inline void operator=(std::ostream & os) { outstream = &os; }
175  inline void set_precision(int prec) { _prec = prec; }
176  inline void set_color(std::string str) { // no chaining <- returns void
177  if(!is_number(str))
178  throw std::runtime_error("DebugPrinter error: invalid set_color() argument");
179  hcol = "\033[0;" + str + "m";
180  hcol_r = "\033[0m";
181  }
182  inline void set_color() { // no chaining <- returns void
183  hcol = "";
184  hcol_r = "";
185  }

198  template <typename T, typename U>
199  inline void operator()(const T& label, const U& obj,
200  const std::string sc = ": ") const {
201 
202  print_stream_impl<m_and<has_stream<T>, has_stream<U> >::value>(label, obj, sc);
203 
204  }
214  template <typename T>
215  inline void operator()(const T& obj) const { operator()(">>> ", obj, ""); }
216 
217 /*******************************************************************************
218  * RTTI (type and stack methods)
219  */
220 
221  template <typename T>
222  inline void type(T obj) const {
223  int dummy;
224  *outstream << demangle( typeid(obj).name() , dummy) << std::endl;
225  }
226 
227  #ifndef DEBUGPRINTER_NO_EXECINFO
228 
229  void stack(
230  const int backtrace_size = max_backtrace,
231  const bool compact = false,
232  const int begin = 1 /* should stay 1 except for special needs */
233  ) const {
234 
235  std::ostream & out = *outstream;
236  int _end = -1; // ignore last
237 
238  void * stack[max_backtrace];
239  int r = backtrace(stack, backtrace_size+begin-_end);
240  char ** symbols = backtrace_symbols(stack, r);
241  if(!symbols) return;
242 
243  int end = r + _end;
244  if(compact == false)
245  out << "DebugPrinter obtained " << end-begin << " stack frames:"
246  << std::endl;
247 
248  #ifndef DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
249 
250  for(int i = begin; i < end; ++i) {
251  std::string prog = " " + prog_part(std::string(symbols[i])) + ": ";
252  std::string mangled = mangled_part(std::string(symbols[i]));
253  std::string offset = " +" + offset_part(std::string(symbols[i]));
254  if(compact == true) { prog = ""; offset = ""; }
255  int status;
256  std::string demangled = demangle(mangled, status);
257  switch (status) {
258  case -1:
259  out << " Error: Could not allocate memory!" << std::endl;
260  break;
261  case -2: // invalid name under the C++ ABI mangling rules
262  out << prog << mangled << offset << std::endl;
263  break;
264  case -3:
265  out << " Error: Invalid argument to demangle()" << std::endl;
266  break;
267  default:
268  out << prog << demangled << offset << std::endl;
269  }
270  }
271  if(compact == false) out << std::endl;
272 
273  #else // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
274 
275  for(int i = begin; i < end; ++i) {
276  if(compact == false)
277  out << " " << symbols[i] << std::endl;
278  else
279  out << mangled_part(std::string(symbols[i])) << std::endl;
280  }
281 
282  if(compact == false) out << std::endl;
283  out << "echo '' && c++filt";
284  for(int i = begin; i < end; ++i)
285  out << " " << mangled_part(std::string(symbols[i]));
286  out << " && echo ''" << std::endl;
287  if(compact == false) out << std::endl;
288 
289  #endif // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
290 
291  free(symbols);
292  }
293 
294  // The dout_FUNC macro pollutes the namespace but is way more convenient
295  //~ #ifndef DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
296  //~ void func() { stack(1, true, 2); }
297  //~ #endif // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
298 
299  #else // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_EXECINFO
300 
301  void stack(
302  const int backtrace_size = max_backtrace,
303  const bool compact = false,
304  const int begin = 1 /* should stay 1 except for special needs */
305  ) const {
306  *outstream << "DebugPrinter::stack() not available" << std::endl;
307  }
308 
309  #endif // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_EXECINFO
310 
311 /*******************************************************************************
312  * Private parts
313  */
314 
315  private:
316 
317  std::ostream * outstream;
318  int _prec;
319  std::string hcol;
320  std::string hcol_r;
321 
322  static const unsigned int max_backtrace = 50;
323  static const unsigned int max_demangled = 4096;
324 
325 
326  #ifndef DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
327 
328  inline std::string demangle(const std::string & str, int & status) const {
329  char * demangled = abi::__cxa_demangle(str.c_str(), 0, 0, &status);
330  std::string out = (status==0) ? std::string(demangled) : str;
331  free(demangled);
332  return out;
333  }
334 
335  #else // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
336 
337  inline std::string demangle(const std::string & str, int & status) const {
338  return str;
339  }
340 
341  #endif // DEBUGPRINTER_NO_CXXABI
342 
343 
344  inline std::string prog_part(const std::string str) const {
345  return str.substr(0, str.find("("));
346  }
347  inline std::string mangled_part(const std::string str) const {
348  std::string::size_type pos = str.find("(") + 1;
349  return str.substr(pos, str.find("+", pos) - pos);
350  }
351  inline std::string offset_part(const std::string str) const {
352  std::string::size_type pos = str.find("+") + 1;
353  return str.substr(pos, str.find(")", pos) - pos);
354  }
355  bool is_number(const std::string& s) {
356  std::string::const_iterator it = s.begin();
357  return !s.empty() && std::find_if(s.begin(), s.end(),
358  [](char c) { return !std::isdigit(c); }) == s.end();
359  }
360 
361  // Select with SFINAE and helper metatemplates
362  template <bool B, typename U, typename V>
363  typename std::enable_if<!B, void>::type
364  print_stream_impl(const U&, const V& obj, const std::string&) const {
365  int dummy;
366  std::string stream = typeid(*outstream).name();
367  *outstream << "DebugPrinter error: object of type "; type(obj);
368  *outstream << " has no suitable " << demangle(stream, dummy)
369  << " operator<< overload." << std::endl;
370  }
371  template <bool B, typename U, typename V>
372  typename std::enable_if<B, void>::type
373  print_stream_impl(const U& label, const V& obj, const std::string& sc) const {
374  *outstream << hcol << label << sc << obj
375  << hcol_r << std::endl;
376  }
377 
378 
379  // TODO: move to external detail
380  template <bool B, typename... T>
381  struct m_and_impl {
382  typedef std::integral_constant<bool , B> type;
383  };
384  template <bool B, typename T, typename... U>
385  struct m_and_impl<B, T, U...> {
386  typedef typename m_and_impl<B && T::value, U...>::type type;
387  };
388  template <typename... T>
389  struct m_and : public m_and_impl<true, T...>::type {
390  };
391 
392  template<typename T, typename S>
393  struct has_stream_impl {
394  template<typename U>
395  static constexpr auto check(int)
396  -> decltype( std::declval<U>() << std::declval<T>(), std::true_type() );
397 
398  template<typename>
399  static constexpr auto check(...) -> std::false_type;
400  typedef decltype(check<S>(0)) type;
401  };
402 
403  template<typename T, typename S = std::ostream>
404  struct has_stream : public has_stream_impl<T, S&>::type { // that ::type has ::value
405  };
406 
407 };
408 
409 /*******************************************************************************
410  * std::ostream overloads
411  */
412 
414 template <typename T>
415 DebugPrinter & operator<<(DebugPrinter & d, const T& output) {
416  std::ostream & out = *d.outstream;
417  size_t savep = (size_t)out.precision();
418  std::ios_base::fmtflags savef =
419  out.setf(std::ios_base::fixed, std::ios::floatfield);
420  out << std::setprecision(d._prec) << std::fixed << output
421  << std::setprecision(savep);
422  out.setf(savef, std::ios::floatfield);
423  out.flush();
424  return d;
425 }
426 
428 inline DebugPrinter & operator<<(DebugPrinter & d,
429  std::ostream& (*pf)(std::ostream&)) {
430  std::ostream & out = *d.outstream;
431  out << pf;
432  return d;
433 }
434 
436 template <typename T>
437 inline DebugPrinter & operator,(DebugPrinter & d, const T& output) {
438  return operator<<(d, output);
439 }
440 
442 inline DebugPrinter & operator,(DebugPrinter & d,
443  std::ostream& (*pf)(std::ostream&)) {
444  return operator<<(d, pf);
445 }

451 
452 // Heap allocate => no destructor call at program exit (wiped by OS).
454 static DebugPrinter& dout = *new DebugPrinter;
455 
456 #define dout_HERE dout(__func__, __LINE__);
457 #define dout_FUNC dout.stack(1, true);
